channel.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
channel.description: Im at the library and i wanna mess around on the 317 version of runescape at home but i dont have internet there and ive been searching for about an hour now can anyone lead me in the right direction please.

item.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Um… download the source, put it on a flash drive, drag and drop to your desktop, and start programming. I used to program without internet.

Read full topic
item.source: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?

item.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

mista pnut:

Make sure to grab the java required.

Oh yeah, this is essential. If you don’t have an internet connection, you probably don’t have a current version of JDK, or maybe you don’t have JDK at all.
Download these files and run them on your home computer:
32-bit (probably what you have if your computer is older - choose this if you’re unsure)
64-bit

item.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97

[quote=“m.dog311, post:7, topic:458651”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=561561.msg4096426#msg4096426 date=1346893891]
Unless your grabbing info from a database, your fine programming on a localhost.
[/quote]
You can run the database locally too…[/quote]
True, I meant if the database is on a webhost. Should of made that clear.

item.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
item.dc:creator: @TimeTM TimeTM
item.description:
@TimeTM wrote:

The Reaper X:

No, everything you’ve downloaded to make the RSPS cannot be accessed locally. Who in their right mind would assume such a thing.

The sarcasm is strong with this one.

item.title: Can i work on a RSPS at home without internet?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Download the files at your library, then insert a flash drive and transfer the files onto the flash drive. Bring the flash drive home and place the files on your desktop. Internet is not required to run the files, but it is required if you want other people playing with you.

Read full topic
